articles.title: RC Chief Proposes S. Korean Counterpart to Have Working Contact
articles.content:
RC Chief Proposes S. Korean Counterpart to Have Working Contact
 Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- The chairman of the Central Committee of the DPRK Red Cross Society Wednesday sent a notice to the president of the Red Cross of south Korea proposing to have a north-south Red Cross working contact to discuss and settle the issue of the four inhabitants of the DPRK detained in south Korea.
					 The DPRK side, repeatedly urging the repatriation of all its detained inhabitants on March 7, proposed having a north-south Red Cross working contact for confirming through a face-to-face meeting the intentions of the four inhabitants the south Korean authorities claimed expressed their will to "defect to the south, " the notice said, adding:
					
					 As regards this proposal, the south side clarified several times its stand that if 27 people are sent back, to begin with, it will be possible to have a north-south working contact to discuss the issue of confirming the intentions of the four people at a face-to-face meeting and allow the north side to directly meet them.
					
					 Now that 27 people came back home, the DPRK side proposed the south Korean side to have the inter-Korean Red Cross working contact to discuss and settle at an early date the issue of confirming the intentions of the four people through a face-to-face meeting and repatriating them at the conference room of the former Neutral Nations Supervisory Commission at Panmunjom at 10 a.m. on April 6.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok Meets UK Parliamentary Leaders
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Meets UK Parliamentary Leaders 
 Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on a visit to UK met and had talks with the president of the House of Lords and the speaker of the House of Commons of Britain at the Parliament building on Mar. 28.
					 Present there from the DPRK side were the party of the chairman and the DPRK ambassador to UK and from the opposite side the chairman of the British-DPRK All-Party Parliamentary Group and officials concerned.
					
					 On the same day Choe met with the deputy foreign secretary of Britain and others.

articles.title: KPA Military Delegation Meets Vietnam Defense Ministry Delegation
articles.content:
KPA Military Delegation Meets Vietnam Defense Ministry Delegation
 Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- Talks between the military delegation of the Korean People's Army and the delegation of the Vietnamese Ministry of Defence were held at the building of the ministry on March 24.
					 Present there from the DPRK side were the members of the military delegation led by Pak Jae Gyong, vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces, and the DPRK ambassador to Vietnam and from the Vietnamese side Nguyen Chi Vinh, deputy minister of Defence, and other officials concerned.
					
					 At the talks both sides exchanged views on the issue of further developing the friendly relations between the armies of the two countries and issues of mutual concern.

articles.title: Mongolian Guests Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Mongolian Guests Pay Homage to Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- L. Purevsuren, foreign policy advisor to the president of Mongolia who is presidential envoy, and his party visited the Kumsusan Memorial Palace Wednesday. 
					 At the palace they paid homage in humble reverence to President Kim Il Sung who made immortal contribution to the development of the friendly relations between the DPRK and Mongolia. 
					
					 The envoy made an entry in the visitor's book.

articles.title: Meeting of Active Sportspersons of Songun Held
articles.content:
Meeting of Active Sportspersons of Songun Held
 Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- A meeting of active sportspersons of Songun was held in the DPRK Wednesday.
					 Present there were Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Kang Nung Su, vice-premier of the Cabinet,  officials concerned and exemplary athletes, coaches, scientists and researchers in the field of sports and officials of related organs.
					
					 Prior to the meeting, its participants heard the recorded speech "Let Us Develop Physical Culture and Sports on a Mass Basis and Prepare All the People for Labour and Defence" made by President Kim Il Sung at the National Conference of Athletes on November 4, 1969.
					
					 The meeting discussed the tasks and ways for bringing about fresh progress in the physical culture.
					
					Minister of Physical Culture and Sports Pak Myong Chol made areport at the meeting which was followed by speeches.
					
					The reporter and speakers noted that General Secretary Kim Jong Il adopted it as the basic sports policy of the WPK to popularize sports and energetically led the work to realize it, they pointed out.
					
					 They told that he defined the ideological campaign, fighting spirit, speed campaign and means of technique as method for sure victory of the Juche-based sports and has taken warm care of the sportspersons' living.
					
					  Calling for priority efforts on the development of events that serve as icons of the DPRK and hopeful events, they underlined the need to key up the interest of the whole society and state in football. 
					
					They stressed that the officials, players and coaches should display the dignity and honor of Songun Korea by snatching many more gold medals.

articles.title: Red Cross Spring Tree-planting Event Held
articles.content:
Red Cross Spring Tree-planting Event Held
 Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- A Red Cross spring tree-planting event took place in Phyongsong City, South Phyongan Province, on Wednesday to mark the period of general mobilization for land management in spring.
					 Present there were officials and members of the DPRK Red Cross Society, young RC members and volunteers, members of the delegation of the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies active in the DPRK and staff members of foreign embassies here.
					
					 Speeches were made at the event.
					
					 Its participants planted pine-nut, acacia and other trees, talking to each other about the spring tree-planting campaign brisk across the country. 
					
					 They went round the disaster prevention structures built with the aid of the Federation. 
					
					 Red Cross spring tree-planting will last till April 10 in dozens of ris of North and South Phyongan Provinces and South Hamgyong Province.

articles.title: Poster for Kimilsungia Festival Produced
articles.content:
Poster for Kimilsungia Festival Produced 
 Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- A poster for the 13th Kimilsungia Festival has been produced in the DPRK. The festival is to take place in Pyongyang on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Depicted in the poster are President Kim Il Sung's native home in Mangyongdae and immortal Kimilsungias in full bloom against the background of blue sky.
					
					 Seen on the upper part of it are letters "The Day of the Sun" and on its lower part letters "The 13th Kimilsungia Festival" and emblem and venue of the festival and its period.

articles.title: Preferential Tariff System in Rason
articles.content:
Preferential Tariff System in Rason 
						
 Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- A preferential tariff system is working in the Rason economic and trade zone of the DPRK.
					 According to the DPRK law on the zone, materials imported for the processing trade are on the free list. 
					
					 The free list also includes materials the foreign investors import for production, management and construction in the zone, export goods produced there and other countries' trade goods passing through the zone.
					
					 As for the dutiable goods, the zone applies lower tariffs to them than other countries' special economic zones.
					
					 Choe Kwang Nam, an official in charge of economic cooperation of the Rason City People's Committee, told KCNA that the zone provides favorable business conditions to foreign investors through the preferential tariff system.

articles.title: Preview of Chinese Film Held
articles.content:
Preview of Chinese Film Held 
 Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- A preview of Chinese feature film "Male and Female Cooks" took place at Taedongmun Cinema on Wednesday. 
					 Present at the preview were officials concerned, creators and artistes of literature and arts field, staff members of the Chinese embassy here, a delegation of China on a visit to the DPRK and Chinese students studying in the DPRK. 
					
					 A speech was made there.

articles.title: New Postage Stamp Issued
articles.content:
New Postage Stamp Issued 
 Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- The State Stamp Bureau of the DPRK issued a sheetlet to mark the International Year of Volunteers 2011.
					 The sheetlet reflects disaster risk reduction, emergency relief and promotion activities.
					
					 After setting 2011 as the International Year of Volunteers, the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies has called for recognizing, supporting and advertising the volunteers' activities throughout the world under the slogan "Find the volunteer inside you". 
					
					 The Red Cross Society of the DPRK has cooperated with volunteers from the humanitarian point of view and in the main principles of Red Cross activities.

articles.title: Preparations for New School Year Brisk
articles.content:
Preparations for New School Year Brisk
 Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- Good preparations have been made in various parts of the country for a new school year.
					 Officials of the Education Commission have given importance to improving the quality of education and its environment at schools of different levels as required by the IT age and minutely organized the work for rounding them off for new school year.
					
					 All the universities in the country have made positive efforts to generalize good experience and put education and experiment and practice on a higher level of IT by organizing exhibitions.
					
					 Pyongyang College of Medicine under Kim Il Sung University, Kim Chaek University of Technology and Kanggye University of Technology modernized visual aid materials and laboratories and dynamically conducted the work to build computer databases of the latest science and technology.
					
					 Colleges across the country have worked out various kinds of teaching plans according to new teaching schedules on the basis of high scientific and technical foundation. 
					
					 Officials and teaching staff in the field of common education have made good preparations to greet the new school year.
					
					 The secondary schools have refurbished well the sites for the study of geography and rooms for automobile practice in conformity with educational contents, while securing a sufficient quantity of various kinds of teaching materials. They have also installed an adequate number of devices for the study of foreign languages and secured multi-media for preparation of the education.
					
					 The units for the production of educational equipment and garment factories have increased the production of textbooks, books, bags, CCD-based microscopes, automatic plotters, school uniforms, etc.
					
					 The party and power organs in various provinces, cities and counties have rendered sincere help in making preparations for the new school year.

articles.title: Scientific, Technical E-Exhibition
articles.content:
Scientific, Technical E-Exhibition
 Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- The e-exhibition of the State Science and Technology Commission draws many people.
					 With more than ten halls of metal, power, machine-building and other economic sectors, the exhibition provides information of latest-type equipment.
					
					 The visitors can get information of machines manufactured by companies of different countries.
					
					 They can also view the performance of machines and their production process through videos.
					
					 The exhibition also offers technical recommendations concerning machines and production process.
					
					 The exhibition updates databases on a regular basis.

articles.title: Three-revolution Exhibition
articles.content:
Three-revolution Exhibition
 Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- The Three-Revolution Exhibition in Sosong District, Pyongyang, displays what the Korean people have achieved in the ideological, technical and cultural fields.
					 It consists of halls of works on the Juche Idea, heavy industry, light industry, agriculture, new technical innovation and electronic industry. 
					
					 The spherical hall of electronic industry shows achievements in electronic, automation and atomic energy industries and space development. 
					
					 The new technical innovation hall hosts international trade fairs and other events.
					
					 The exhibition provides visitors with a good understanding of the country's economic development and the policy of the Workers' Party of Korea for the building of a thriving nation.

articles.title: Mt. Chilbo, Tourist Resort
articles.content:
Mt. Chilbo, Tourist Resort
						
Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- Mt. Chilbo in North Hamgyong Province is one of the six famous mountains in Korea.
					 Chilbo means seven treasures. The mountain, covering about 250 square kilometers, divides into three parts--Inner Chilbo, Outer Chilbo and Sea Chilbo.
					
					 Seen in the mountain are such famous relics as Sungson Pavilion and Kaesim Temple.
					
					 There are Hwangjin, Myongchon and many other hot springs in and around the mountain.
					
					 The mountain is also famous for songi mushroom (Armillaria).
					
					 It is not far from Rason City, an economic and trade zone.
					
					 Lines of the East Sea provide good conditions for sight-seeing tour to the mountain. 
					
					 It is planned to build more hotels, lodgings and cures around the mountain.

articles.title: Ever-developing Martial Arts
articles.content:
Ever-developing Martial Arts
 Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- The 4th International Martial Arts Games took place in Estonia in February.
					 Participating in the games were players from tens of countries, including the DPRK, Russia, Germany, Italy and Iran. Matches were held in nine events such as Taekwon-Do, karate, pankration and muaythai and demonstrations in eight events.
					
					 The games clearly showed that martial arts was ever developing in the world, drawing greater public interest.
					
					 Martial arts games are conducive to boosting friendship and cooperation among martial arts players, promoting health and building a peaceful, new world.
					
					 The International Martial Art Games Commission was organized in September Juche 88 (1999).
					
					 It has embraced many international and national martial arts organizations.
					
					 Its headquarters is in Pyongyang and the first international martial arts games took place in the DPRK in 2004.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Blasts S. Korean Military's Confrontation Hysteria
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Blasts S. Korean Military's Confrontation Hysteria 
 Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- There are very disturbing moves of the south Korean military on the lapse of one year since the warship "Cheonan" case occurred.
					 The puppet navy staged large naval drills including the one for dropping depth bombs in the East, West and South seas of Korea for several days with dozens of warships, sea patrol planes and helicopters involved. The ground and air forces staged live-shell firing exercises in the "Sungjin drill ground" in Kyonggi Province with various type artillery pieces, F-15k fighters and other huge armed forces involved.
					
					 The south Korean military authorities are using the said case as a justification for rounding off the preparations for a new war.
					
					 They invested several times field commanding officers not only of the frontline units but of all other units of the army with the right to start operations and open fire with their own determinations. They introduced a huge quantity of war hardware from the U.S. and inducted them to the puppet army.
					
					 They have staged the largest-ever combined naval maneuvers and joint military exercises in league with the U.S. for the last several months, claiming that they were aimed to deter someone's "additional provocations." They are, at the same time, keen to mount a preemptive attack on the DPRK anytime.
					
					 It is as clear as noonday that such actions are screwing up the situation on the Korean Peninsula and pushing it to the brink of war.
					
					 What merits a more serious attention is that the puppet clique is using the above-said case as a card for instilling the war consciousness and spirit of inter-Korean confrontation into the younger generation and all other south Koreans.
					
					 It sponsored memorial services and other events in Seoul and other places from March 24 to 28 in a bid to brand the case as a "provocation" by the DPRK.
					
					 Worse still, it took people to the theatres of military exercises and went the lengths of erecting even a "cenotaph" on Paekryong Island.
					
					 The military exercises and memorial services staged by the puppet clique on the above-said occasion are nothing but the confrontation hysteria kicked up to create military and political environment for orchestrating the second and third "Cheonan" cases.
					
					 Intolerable are its moves to cook up the second "Cheonan" case. 
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will never remain a passive onlooker to the moves of the south Korean military authorities for aggression but sternly retaliate against them.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Discloses US Military Strategic Scenario
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Discloses US Military Strategic Scenario 
 Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- A sinister intention is hidden behind the U.S. warlike forces' much touted military "threat" and "provocation" from someone, observes Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a bylined article. 
					 It is the U.S. aggressive Korea strategy and Asia strategy to stifle the DPRK by force of arms and expand the sphere of domination and control with the Korean Peninsula as a springboard, the article notes, and goes on: 
					
					 The U.S. has run the whole gamut of means and methods to bring down socialism in the DPRK, but all of them ended in a failure. The last card in the hand of the U.S. is to implement the plan for second Korean war of aggression. In other words, the U.S. is keen to bring down the system in the DPRK by force of arms at any cost. The U.S. warlike forces are getting frantic in their moves to take military "counteractions" against the DPRK while staging the war exercises against it together with the south Korean puppet forces. This cannot be interpreted otherwise than a curtain-raiser to the operation of the U.S. 
					
					 The U.S. imperialists' military strategic scenario towards the DPRK is no more than a daydream. The U.S. warlike forces would be well advised to stop their rash acts, bearing deep in mind that no aggressive strategic scenario can work on the DPRK.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Labels US Harasser of Peace
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Labels US Harasser of Peace
 Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- The Stockholm International Peace Research Institute of Sweden recently announced that the U.S. has topped the world list of arms sale.
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes in a signed commentary carried in this regard:
					
					 This clearly indicates that the U.S. is the world's biggest arms dealer and a dangerous chieftain of war.
					
					 The U.S. is busy massively selling various type weapons in a bid to bring enormous profits to big munitions monopolies, create imbalance of strength and spark military confrontation in the relevant regions and escalate them into armed clashes and war.
					
					 From this point of view, the U.S. arms sale is, in essence, an export of war.
					
					 It is the trite method of the U.S. to deploy its forces in relevant regions and bring them under military control under this or that pretext after escalating conflicts and sparking a war.
					
					 Due to the massive introduction of U.S.-made weapons, south Korea is getting ever more subject to its master militarily and being reduced to a war marionette acting according to the U.S. policy program for aggression against the DPRK.
					
					 This being a hard reality, the U.S. is apt to talking about someone's "threat to security." 
					
					 The U.S. imperialists' claim that the measures taken by the DPRK to bolster up its military capability for self-defence pose "threat" to the security of Northeast Asia and the world is nothing but rhetoric to justify their moves for a war of aggression and mislead public opinion.
					
					 With no artifice can the U.S. hide its true colors as the arch criminal harassing peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula and the rest of the world and escalating the arms race.

articles.title: Hyon In Thaek Termed Traitor to Nation--Minju Joson
articles.content:
Hyon In Thaek Termed Traitor to Nation--Minju Joson 
 Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- Hyon In Thaek, minister of Unification of south Korea, is a traitor to the nation who can no longer remain a member of the Korean nation.
					 Minju Joson Wednesday observes this in a bylined commentary. 
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 He was reported to have asserted on March 24 that the DPRK should make an apology for the warship "Cheonan" sinking case and make a decision over the issue.
					
					While speaking ill of the DPRK's sincere efforts to improve the north-south ties, he went the lengths of talking nonsense that south Korea would significantly develop the inter-Korean relations if the north shows its sincerity.
					
					 This is unpardonable outbursts making a mockery of all the fellow countrymen who want to warm the inter-Korean ties through a thorough probe into the truth behind the conspiratorial warship sinking case and wide-ranging dialogue.
					
					 This, at the same time, betrays a black-hearted intention of the conservative forces to deteriorate the inter-Korean relations in the future, too, through such hideous conspiratorial farces as the above-said case orchestrated by the puppet clique under the manipulation of the U.S. 
					
					 It was Hyon who torpedoed the north-south dialogue arranged thanks to the DPRK's positive initiative and sincere efforts. Hence, he kicked off such "reckless dialogue offensive" in a bid to divert elsewhere the accusing finger pointed to him. 
					
					 As saying goes that a crow is never whiter for often washing, one can hear from him only utterances slandering fellow countrymen and disclosing his intention to do harm to them.
					
					 The reality goes to prove that it is impossible to repair the north-south relations as long as Hyon is allowed to stay in his office. 
					
					 Hyon is bound to face a stern judgment of the nation before long as he is hell-bent on such anti-reunification acts. 
					
					 He would be well advised not to regret later but quit the political arena by himself, though belatedly.

articles.title: Anti-DPRK Remarks of S. Korean Official Blasted
articles.content:
Anti-DPRK Remarks of S. Korean Official Blasted
 Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- Hyon In Thaek, puppet minister of Unification of south Korea, on March 24 slandered the DPRK again over the case of warship "Cheonan" sinking. Speaking at a meeting of an organization in Seoul, he said that "the north should show its sincerity." 
					 This is a shameless remark intended to justify the confrontation policy pursued by the south Korean authorities under the pretext of the case. 
					
					 Over the past one year they have been hell-bent on the unprecedented anti-DPRK campaign, insisting on its involvement in the warship case. 
					
					 They rendered the situation tense through such moves as announcement of "halt to the north-south trading and exchange", adoption of "anti-north resolution", resumption of anti-DPRK psychological warfare and launch of war exercises against the DPRK. Meanwhile, they peddled the argument about "the north's involvement" abroad, begging for international "cooperation" aimed at sanction against the DPRK.
					
					 The group of traitors also made reckless firing of shells at territorial waters of the DPRK around Yonphyong Island in November last year despite its prior warnings only to suffer a due punishment.
					
					 Nevertheless, it demanded an "apology" before bringing all of the north-south dialogues and exchanges to rupture.
					
					 Hyon's recent talk about "sincerity" is aimed to evade the blame for the bedeviled inter-Korean relations and the acute tension and continue the confrontation with fellow countrymen.

articles.title: S. Korea Accused of Pursuing Confrontation with Compatriots
articles.content:
S. Korea Accused of Pursuing Confrontation with Compatriots
 Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty of south Korea in its statement on March 26 called for bringing to justice the present puppet authorities for escalating the confrontation with fellow countrymen while concealing the truth behind the warship "Cheonan" sinking case.
					 The statement said:
					
					 Not only the majority of people but the international community did not believe "torpedo No.1" which the south Korean authorities produced as critical evidence proving the warship "Cheonan" sinking case. Nevertheless, the authorities are using the case as a lever for escalating the confrontation between the south and the north and maintaining power, concealing the truth about the case. 
					
					 The statement blasted the authorities for persistently staging exercises for a war of aggression against the north, raising a hue and cry over "provocations by the north," "examination of the posture for strong counter-action" and the like though one year has passed since the occurrence of the case.

articles.title: Koreans in Japan Meet
articles.content:
Koreans in Japan Meet
Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- A meeting of Koreans in Japan was held at the Korean Hall in Tokyo on Mar. 28 to express thanks to General Secretary Kim Jong Il for sending relief fund to the Koreans in Japan who suffered from the massive quake and ensuing tsunami.
					 Present there were Ho Jong Man, chief vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), and other leading officials and the chairmen of the headquarters of Chongryon in the quake-stricken regions and compatriots. 
					
					 Ho's report was followed by speeches.
					
					 Ho said that all the officials of Chongryon and Koreans in Japan were deeply moved to hear the news that Kim Jong Il sent out of his loving care relief fund amounting to 500 000 U.S. dollars to the Koreans in the quake-hit areas.
					
					 He said that Chongryon officials and compatriots would conduct activities to rescue Koreans in the afflicted areas as a movement of all organizations and compatriots, bearing deep in mind the noble intention of Kim Jong Il who sent the above-said fund.
					
					 He called upon all the Koreans to get united close and give play to their energies, wisdom and patriotic zeal to bring the activities of Chongryon organizations and living of the Koreans in the quake-stricken regions to normal as early as possible  and effect a surge in the overall work of Chongryon.
					
					 A letter to Kim Jong Il was read out at the meeting.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Praised by Lao Paper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Praised by Lao Paper
 Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- The February issue of the Lao paper Meying Lao carried an article titled "Kim Jong Il, Dear Son of People" with a photo of him waving back to the cheering crowd.
					 The article said:
					
					General Secretary Kim Jong Il has always worshiped the popular masses, saying that they are an almighty being in the world.
					
					 He usually teaches that officials should be modest and free and easy in their approach to the people.
					
					 Boundless simplicity and informality represent the noble traits of the leader as a commoner who regards him as son of the people while easily mixing with them.
					
					 He has energetically continued the forced march of field guidance to build a thriving socialist country in Korea at an early date where the people lead a happy life with nothing more to envy in the world.
					
					 That is why he enjoys absolute trust and reverence from the Korean people.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Remembered in Mexico
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Remembered in Mexico
 Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- The Mexican Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea released the 73rd issue of its bulletin on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The bulletin carried an article titled "Mangyongdae" with a photo of the President's old home in Mangyongdae.
					
					 Noting that the straw-thatched house where the President was born is still preserved in its original state, the bulletin said that patriots who dedicated their lives to the country and the nation through generations lived at this house.
					
					 Introducing in detail members of the Mangyongdae family, it said:
					
					 Mangyongdae has become a sacred place of the revolution endlessly visited by not only the Korean people but also the progressives of the world following the Juche idea and aspiring after independence.
					
					 The Korean people at home and abroad and personages of different countries visit this place while looking back upon the great life of the President.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Nigeria
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Off Press in Nigeria
						
 Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Exalt the Brilliance of Comrade Kim Il Sung's Idea on the Youth Movement and the Achievements Made under His Leadership" was brought out in booklet by the Megareach Ventures Publishing House of Nigeria on the occasion of the birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The work, published on August 24, Juche 85 (1996), elaborates on the essence of the Juche-oriented youth movement and the idea and theory on it put forward by the President and his immortal feats made in leading the youth movement. It also clarifies the tasks and ways for further developing this movement in keeping with the requirement of its new higher stage.

articles.title: Day of Sun to Be Commemorated in Switzerland
articles.content:
Day of Sun to Be Commemorated in Switzerland
 Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- A preparatory committee for commemorating the Day of the Sun, the birthday of President Kim Il Sung, was formed in Switzerland with due ceremony on March 20.
					 Martin Lotscher, chairman of the Switzerland-Korea Committee, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					  A statement, adopted at the inaugural ceremony, said that the President is the great national hero, liberator and savior of the Korean people as he founded the Juche idea, the Songun idea and, on this basis, led the Korean revolution to victory.
					
					 The preparatory committee will set the days from March 20 to April 20 as a commemoration period and post on Internet websites works of the President and articles on his feats and hold colorful political and cultural events in the period, it said.

articles.title: Leakage of Radioactive Substance Goes on in Japan
articles.content:
Leakage of Radioactive Substance Goes on in Japan 
						
 Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) --The leakage of radioactive substance from the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant in Japan is going on.
					 The chief Cabinet secretary of Japan said at a press conference on Monday that a high level of radioactive substance is being detected in the turbine pool of Reactor No. 2 because of the water leaking from the containment vessel. 
					
					 Radioactive materials 1,000 times higher than the limit level were detected in the water around the building that houses Reactors Nos. 1 and 3. 
					
					 On March 26 radioactive substance more than 1 250 times the limit level was confirmed in the seawater near the nuclear power plant. Radioactive materials 1,850 times higher than that were detected 24 hours later. 
					
					 The Tokyo Electric Power Co. announced on Tuesday that a high level of plutonium was discovered in the soil of five locations in the compound of the power plant. 
					
					 Radioactive iodine was detected in 8 areas of south Korea including Seoul as of Tuesday while radioactive substance that leaked from Japan keeps spreading to other countries and regions.
					
					 The death toll caused by the quake and the ensuing tsunami reached 10,872, the number of those unaccounted for 16,244 and that of the wounded 2,776 as of 10:00 of Monday, the National Police Agency of Japan said.

articles.title: Canada Blocks Import of Agricultural Products from Japan's Radiation Zone
articles.content:
Canada Blocks Import of Agricultural Products from Japan's Radiation Zone
 Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- Canada took a measure for blocking the import of agricultural products from Japan. 
					 The Food Inspection Agency of Canada on March 23 made public its decision to stop the import of agricultural products from four prefectures in Japan including Fukushima, Gunma and Ibaraki as the radioactive contamination due to the accident at the nuclear power plant in Japan is getting serious.

articles.title: Aftershocks Occur in Myanmar
articles.content:
Aftershocks Occur in Myanmar
						
Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- Several aftershocks occurred in Myanmar on March 27 in the wake of the magnatitude-7.0 quake that hit its eastern area on March 24.
					 They left more dwelling houses destroyed and many people homeless.
					
					 Rescue operation is going on in the afflicted area.

articles.title: Iranian Lawmakers Slam UN Human Rights Resolution against Iran
articles.content:
Iranian Lawmakers Slam UN Human Rights Resolution against Iran 
 Teheran, March 28 (KCNA) -- A number of Iranian lawmakers on Mar. 26 criticized the United Nations Human Rights Council for adopting an anti-Iran resolution.
					 The UN Human Rights Council voted for a European resolution proposal for appointing a special rapporteur to monitor human rights situation in Iran. In this regard, they said that the U.S. and the Western countries are using the UN as a tool to achieve their unholy objectives.
					
					 "By issuing this resolution, those who claim for human rights want to deflect world public opinion from the U.S.-led air attacks on Libya," they held.

articles.title: Palestinian Official Dismisses Israeli Newspaper's False Report
articles.content:
Palestinian Official Dismisses Israeli Newspaper's False Report 
 Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- Azzam al-Ahmad, member of the Fatah's Central Committee, Sunday strongly rejected the false report by an Israeli newspaper.
					 An Israeli newspaper reported on this day that President Mahmoud Abbas was likely to cancel his visit, which has not yet been scheduled, after the military wing of the Hamas said they could not secure his safety once he arrives in Gaza.
					
					 "Israel is interested in blocking Abbas' choices regarding the reconciliation," said Azzam al-Ahmad.

articles.title: Myanmar Newspaper Calls for Unity between Army and People
articles.content:
Myanmar Newspaper Calls for Unity between Army and People
 Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- The New Light of Myanmar in an editorial marking the 66th anniversary of Armed Forces Day on Sunday called for all citizens to cooperate with the Tatmadaw (armed forces) to build a peaceful, modern and developed democratic nation.
					 "It is the Tatmadaw that has always stood by the nation and the people in times of emergency," the editorial said.

articles.title: Program against Irregularities and Corruption Ratified in Kazakhstan
articles.content:
Program against Irregularities and Corruption Ratified in Kazakhstan
 Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- The government of Kazakhstan on Mar. 24 ratified the program against irregularities and corruption for the next five years.
					 The purpose of the program is to create atmosphere against them and raise the law-abiding consciousness and deepen the trust of the citizens in the institutions of the country.

articles.title: Canada's Harper Government Defeated by Parliament Non-Confidence Vote
articles.content:
Canada's Harper Government Defeated by Parliament Non-Confidence Vote
						
 Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- The Canadian House of Commons passed on Mar. 25 a non-confidence motion tabled by opposition parties, defeating the ruling Conservative government led by Prime Minister Stephen Harper for contempt of Parliament.
					 It made the Harper government the first one defeated for being in contempt of Parliament in Canada's history.
					
					 Liberal leader Michael Ignatieff said that the government is in contempt of Parliament for refusing to supply enough information on the cost of the F-35 fighter jets procurement, their justice system reforms and their projections for corporate profits and tax rates.

articles.title: Chinese Officials Participate in Compulsory Tree Planting Campaign
articles.content:
Chinese Officials Participate in Compulsory Tree Planting Campaign 
 Beijing, March 28 (KCNA) -- 197 officials of Chinese national institutions took part in the compulsory tree planting campaign in Binghe Park in Tong-zhou District of Beijing on March 26. 
					 They were from institutions directly under the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and different ministries and commissions directly under the state. 
					
					 The said campaign has been conducted since 2002.

articles.title: Russia Takes Measures to Prevent Forest Fires
articles.content:
Russia Takes Measures to Prevent Forest Fires 
 Moscow, March 28 (KCNA) -- Russia is channeling efforts into preventing forest fires.
					 The Russian paper Kommersant on March 24 said that the Federal General Bureau for Forest Management would round off the system whereby forests are patrolled by drones and sources of forest fires monitored by a satellite from May 1. 
					
					 1.5 billion Rbl bigger allocation will be made this year than last year for preventing forest fires. This is the biggest in the last two decades, the paper said.

articles.title: Mexican President Warns of Growing Water Crisis
articles.content:
Mexican President Warns of Growing Water Crisis
  Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- Mexican President Felipe Calderon, speaking at an event on March 23, stressed the importance of solving water problem.
					 The fast process of industrialization has demanded more use of water, he said, adding that the government has placed water as a topic under the national security agenda.
					
					 He stressed that the water agenda, established by the government to solve the water problem, is aimed at preserving the water resources.

articles.title: Developing Nations Work to Eradicate Poverty
articles.content:
Developing Nations Work to Eradicate Poverty
 Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- Developing countries are working hard for the elimination of poverty, setting it as a steady important task. 
					 The president of South Africa said that to eliminate poverty has become a pressing issue in the African continent though it is rich in land resources. For its solution, it is important for the countries in the continent to develop agriculture and ensure the food security and achieve economic growth, he added.
					
					 At present the continental countries sell raw materials at low price and, instead, import finished goods at high price, the Tanzanian president pointed out, saying: An important way for eradicating poverty in Africa is to develop the industry.
					
					 Brazilian President Dilma Vana Rousseff set the eradication of poverty as the priority task of the government, urging its organs at different levels to strive to maintain the standard of stable economic development and attain the aim of eradicating poverty. 
					
					 Developing countries are making successes in the drive to eliminate poverty through substantial measures.
					
					 The Malaysian government pushes ahead with this drive under the goal of reducing the nation's poverty rate to 2 percent until 2015 through implementation of the 2010-2015 socio-economic development plan.
					
					 In Indonesia the poverty rate was decreased to 13.3 percent last year from 16.6 percent of 2009 by the government's positive efforts.
					
					 Angola reduced its poverty rate into 38 percent in 2009 from 63 percent of 2002 while Venezuela decreased its destitution rate into 7.1 percent in the first half of last year from 21 percent of 1998.
					
					 Bolivia cut down the rate 10 percent into 30 last year. The country plans to reduce the rate 9 percent this year.

articles.title: Slave Labor, Serious World Problem
articles.content:
Slave Labor, Serious World Problem
 Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- Many people are still subject to slave labor worldwide, arousing great concern.
					 The president of the UN General Assembly highlighted on Mar. 25 that more than 10 million people globally still remain trapped in forced labor.

articles.title: Anti-US Protest in Pakistan
articles.content:
Anti-US Protest in Pakistan
 Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- Hundreds of persons Saturday protested in the Pakistani City of Lahore against the liberation of a U.S. citizen accused of murder and against the air attacks made by the U.S. drones in the northwest of the Islamic country.
					 They took to street and strongly protested against the air attacks by U.S. drones, shouting anti-American slogans.

articles.title: Prices Go up in Belarus
articles.content:
Prices Go up in Belarus 
 Pyongyang, March 30 (KCNA) -- The Ministry of Economy of Belarus declared on Mar. 23 that the price of bread would go up by 10 percent for the next two months.
					 The prices of various kinds of oil products have jumped 5-10 percent since the outset of this month and there is a limit on the sale of fuel oil at the fuel oil supply stations.

articles.title: Presidente del CC de ACR repropone contacto a su par surcoreano
articles.content:
Presidente del CC de ACR repropone contacto a su par surcoreano
						
Pyongyang, 30 de marzo (ATCC) -- El presidente del Comite Central de la Asociacion de la Cruz Roja de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea envio este miercoles un aviso a su homologo surcoreano, en el cual propuso de nuevo el contacto de trabajo de cruz roja N-S para debatir y resolver el problema de 4 norcoreanos retenidos en el Sur de Corea.
					  El aviso recordo que el pasado dia 7, la parte Norte ya habia propuesto el mismo contacto para verificar mediante la entrevista directa con 4 personas, que segun las autoridades surcoreanas, expusieron la voluntad de "quedarse en suelo surcoreano", demandando otra vez la devolucion de todos los retenidos.
					
					  Al respecto, la parte Sur expuso en varias ocasiones su posicion de devolver primero a 27 de los 31 retenidos y acudir despues al contacto de trabajo N-S para debatir y posibilitar la entrevista directa con los 4 restantes, anadio.
					
					  Puesto que se realizo ya el regreso de 27 habitantes nuestros, proponemos sostener el contacto a las 10 de la manana del 6 de abril en la sala de reuniones de la ex Comision de Supervision de Naciones Neutrales en Phanmunjom para discutir y resolver rapido dicho tema y la devolucion de los 4 restantes, concluyo.

articles.title: Conversan las delegaciones militares de Corea y Cambodia
articles.content:
Conversan las delegaciones militares de Corea y Cambodia
						
Pyongyang, 30 de marzo (ATCC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 28 las conversaciones entre la delegacion militar del Ejercito Popular de Corea y la del Ministerio de Defensa de Cambodia en la sede de esta cartera.
					En la ocasion estuvieron presentes por la parte coreana los miembros de la delegacion militar encabezada por el viceministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares, Pak Jae Gyong, y el embajador coreano en Cambodia y por la contraparte, el jefe del Departamento General de Politica y Relaciones Exteriores, quien es asesor del ministro de Defensa, y otros funcionarios de esta cartera.
					
					Ambas partes intercambiaron las opiniones sobre el mayor desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad entre los ejercitos de los dos paises y otros temas de interes mutuo.

articles.title: ATCC comenta sospechosos movimientos en el Sur de Corea
articles.content:
ATCC comenta sospechosos movimientos en el Sur de Corea
Pyongyang, 30 de marzo (ATCC) -- En ocasion del primer aniversario del incidente de hundimiento de la corbeta "Cheonan", la capa militar del Sur de Corea libro durante varios dias en los mares Este, Oeste y Sur de Corea los ejercicios maritimos de gran envergadura como el lanzamiento de bombas de profundidad movilizando decenas de lanchas, aviones de patrulla naval y helicopteros. 
					Las fuerzas terrestres y aereas desarrollaron tambien en el "campo de entrenamiento Sungjin" de la provincia de Kyonggi el entrenamiento de tiro real introduciendo enorme cantidad de armamentos como los canones de distintos tipos y los cazas "F-15K".
					
					Ahora las autoridades militares surcoreanas toman el caso de "Cheonan" como justificacion para completar los preparativos de nueva guerra. 
					
					Dieron en varias ocasiones a los comandantes de las unidades en el frente y las otras de todo el ejercito el derecho a iniciar la operacion y abrir el fuego segun sus decisiones independientes. E introdujeron en el ejercito titere muchos pertrechos belicos estadounidenses. 
					
					Dicen por una parte que los simulacros conjuntos nunca vistos en la historia, que se desarrollan constantemente en contubernio con EE.UU., son para frenar las "provocaciones adicionales" de alguien, y por la otra, intentan asestar el ataque preventivo contra la RPDC en cualquier momento. 
					
					Es muy obvio que tales acciones militares agravan la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana y acarrean el peligro de guerra. 
					
					Lo mas grave del caso es que los titeres surcoreanos abusan del incidente de "Cheonan" para inculcar a los habitantes y las generaciones venideras la conciencia belicista y de confrontacion fratricida con el Norte. 
					
					En los actos de memoria y otros realizados desde el dia 24 al 28 en Seul y otras localidades, calificaron el caso de "Cheonan" de una "provocacion" de la RPDC. 
					
					Ademas, llevaron a los habitantes a los campos de entrenamiento militar y levantaron en la isla Paekryong el "monumento en memoria de los caidos". 
					
					Todos los pasos arriba mencionados no pasan de ser una locura para preparar el ambiente militar y politico que de lugar al segundo y tercer casos de "Cheonan". 
					
					El ejercito y pueblo de la RPDC no estaran con brazos cruzados ante tal proceder imperdonable de las autoridades militares surcoreanas y les responderan rotundamente.

articles.title: Impreso afiche del XIII Festival de Kimilsungias
articles.content:
Impreso afiche del XIII Festival de Kimilsungias
Pyongyang, 30 de marzo (ATCC) -- Quedo impreso el afiche del XIII Festival de Kimilsungias que tendra lugar en esta capital con motivo del cumpleanos del Presidente Kim Il Sung. 
					En esta pancarta se ven la casa natal del Presidente en Mangyongdae y Kimilsungia en pleno florecimiento teniendo en su fondo el cielo azul. 
					
					En la parte superior e inferior se leen las letras "Dia del Sol" y "XIII Festival de Kimilsungias", respectivamente.
					
					Igualmente se ven el emblema, el lugar y el periodo del festival.

articles.title: Se aplica arancel favorecido en zona economica y comercial de Rason
articles.content:
Se aplica arancel favorecido en zona economica y comercial de Rason
						
Pyongyang, 30 de marzo (ATCC) -- Se aplica la tarifa favorecida en la zona economica y comercial de Rason de Corea. 
					En virtud de la ley de la zona economica y comercial de Rason de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, son libres de aranceles las mercancias para elaboracion, los materiales de las empresas inversionistas extranjeras para la produccion, la gestion y la construccion de esta zona, las exportaciones producidas en la zona, y las cargas de otros paises que pasan por aqui.
					
					Ademas, se imponen aranceles a precio bajo que en las zonas economicas especiales de otros paises. 
					
					El colaborador economico del Comite Popular de la Ciudad de Rason, Choe Kwang Nam (de 38 anos de edad) dijo a la ATCC que el sistema arancelario de esta zona asegura las condiciones favorables a las actividades empresarias de los inversionistas extranjeros.
